thread.section_title: Man Utd and Liverpool stars caught up in shocking pitch invasion during Ivory Coast v Senegal – Metro
thread.title: Man Utd and Liverpool stars caught up in shocking pitch invasion during Ivory Coast v Senegal
thread.title_full: Man Utd and Liverpool stars caught up in shocking pitch invasion during Ivory Coast v Senegal

author: Simon Rice
title: Man Utd and Liverpool stars caught up in shocking pitch invasion during Ivory Coast v Senegal
text:
A pitch invader tackles Lamine Gassama of Senegal (Getty) Premier League stars including Eric Bailly and Sadio Mane were caught up in shocking scenes in Paris last night.
They were among those who featured in a friendly between Ivory Coast and Senegal which had to be abandoned after a mass pitch invasion.
Real Madrid ace hints he has HUGE problem with Arsenal star on social media Dozens of supporters evaded security to gain access to the pitch at the Charlety Stadium on the outskirts of Paris, with one invader rugby tackling Senegal’s Lamine Gassama. Other players were also confronted by the minority set on causing trouble.
With people streaming onto the pitch, referee Tony Chapron ordered the players from the field and the match was cancelled in the 88th minute.
A spectator evades security (Getty) Many made it onto the pitch (Getty) Fans race on (Getty) The match had to be abandoned (Getty) Photographs emerged afterwards which appeared to show people vaulting the stadium fence, presumably without tickets, shortly before the trouble.
Spectators climb over railings (Getty) Those who entered the field were in the minority (Getty) As well as Manchester United defender Bailly and Liverpool striker Sadio Mane, Crystal Palace winger Wilfried Zaha and Everton’s Idrissa Gueye were involved in the match.
Zaha’s tweet Wilfried Zaha made no reference to the pitch invasion in a post-match tweet…
Unbeaten in our last 2 games. Hopefully we can continue this run into the WorldCup qualifiers. Thanks for your support #GodIsGreat #CIV pic.twitter.com/vsWVWARr0j 
— Wilfried Zaha (@wilfriedzaha) March 27, 2017 

More: Football Germany legend: This is why Ozil hasn't signed new Arsenal contract 
£50m Prem star perfect for back three decides on summer move to Chelsea 
Is Eden Hazard already preparing for Real Madrid switch? 
Sadio Mane scored from the spot (Getty) Cyriac with the equaliser for Ivory Coast (Getty) The game was level at 1-1 before it was called off with Mane’s penalty cancelled out by Cyriac, who is currently on loan at Fulham.
MORE: Mesut Ozil yet to sign new Arsenal contract because of Arsene Wenger, says Michael Ballack
